etymologies: mid 19th century: from Greek isomerēs ‘sharing equally’, from isos ‘equal’ + meros ‘a share’

definitions: each of two or more compounds with the same formula but a different arrangement of atoms in the molecule and different properties.
shortDefinitions: each of two or more compounds with same formula but different arrangement of atoms in molecule

definitions: each of two or more atomic nuclei that have the same atomic number and the same mass number but different energy states.
shortDefinitions: each of two or more atomic nuclei that have same atomic number
